document_data.title: Realms of Valor
document_data.author: [[Mark Anthony]], [[Scott Ciencin]], [[David Cook]], [[Elaine Cunningham]], [[Troy Denning]], [[Christie Golden]], [[Ed Greenwood]], [[Jeff Grubb]], [[James Lowder]], [[Douglas Niles]], [[Jean Rabe]], [[R.A. Salvatore]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Realms of Valor''''', edited by [[James Lowder]], was the first anthology of short stories from the ''[[Forgotten Realms]]''.

{{Quote|''From the secret annals of Realms history come eleven never-before-published tales of valor, featuring the greatest heroes of that magical world—[[Drizzt Do'Urden]], [[Arilyn Moonblade]], [[Adon]], [[Elminster]] of [[Shadowdale]], [[Jander Sunstar]], and many others—told by your favorite authors, including: [[R. A. Salvatore]], [[Ed Greenwood]], [[Douglas Niles]], [[Troy Denning]], [[Christie Golden]], and others.''}}
document_data.Contents:
* "[[/The Lord of Lowhill|The Lord of Lowhill]]" by [[Douglas Niles]], in which [[Pawldo]] and a youngling brave the [[Palace of Skulls]].
* "[[Elminster at the Magefair]]" by [[Ed Greenwood]], in which [[Elminster Aumar|Elminster]] and [[Storm Silverhand]] visit a [[magefair]].
* "[[/One Last Drink|One Last Drink]]" by [[Christie Golden]], in which [[Jander Sunstar]] escapes the yoke of his [[vampire]] lord, [[Cassiar]].
* "[[The Bargain]]" by [[Elaine Cunningham]], in which [[Arilyn Moonblade]] and [[Danilo Thann]] are hunted by [[assassin]]s in [[Tethyr]].
* "[[/Patronage|Patronage]]" by [[David Cook]], in which the lama [[Koja]] seeks to publish a book on the [[Tuigan]] war.
* "[[/A Virtue by Reflection|A Virtue by Reflection]]" by [[Scott Ciencin]], in which [[Myrmeen Lhal]] must investigate a murder in her own backyard.
* "[[/King's Tear|King's Tear]]" by [[Mark Anthony]], in which [[Tyveris]] must recover the [[Tear of Everard]] to prove his worth as a loremaster.
* "[[/The Family Business|The Family Business]]" by [[James Lowder]], in which [[Artus Cimber]] and his father save prince [[Azoun Obarskyr IV|Azoun]] from [[Zhentarim]] assassins.
* "[[/Grandfather's Toys|Grandfather's Toys]]" by [[Jean Rabe]], in which [[Galvin]] must find a lost girl in a [[wizard]]'s tower.
* "[[/The Curse of Tegea|The Curse of Tegea]]" by [[Troy Denning]], in which [[Adon]] must rid a village of its [[curse]].
* "[[Dark Mirror]]" by [[R.A. Salvatore]], in which [[Drizzt Do'Urden]] encounters a [[goblin]] and learns a valuable lesson about prejudice.
* Afterword by [[Jeff Grubb]]
